channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ICE and CBP’s Face-Recognition App Can’t Actually Verify Who People Are
item.description: ICE has used Mobile Fortify to identify immigrants and citizens alike over 100,000 times, by one estimate. It wasn't built to work like that—and only ...

item.title: Loyalty Is Dead in Silicon Valley
item.description: Founders used to be wedded to their companies. Now, anyone can be lured away for the right price.

item.title: The Rise and Fall of the World's Largest Gay Dating App
item.description: The new book The Wall Dancers explores the uneasy relationship between Chinese internet users and a government that is always watching.

item.title: One of Europe’s largest universities knocked offline for days after cyberattack
item.description: An alleged ransomware attack has taken down the systems of the Sapienza University of Rome.

item.title: A16z VC wants founders to stop stressing over insane ARR numbers
item.description: A16z VC Jennifer Li⁠, who oversees some of the firm's fastest growing AI companies, warns founders not to believe every ARR claim made on X.

item.title: The 2026 Winter Olympics Will Have a Major Impact on the Region’s Snow
item.description: A recent report found that carbon emissions caused by the Milano Cortina Olympics could lead to the loss of 5.5 square kilometers of snowpack and mill...

item.title: 9 Great Deals on WIRED-Approved Valentine’s Day Gifts (2026)
item.description: These swoon-worthy deals on WIRED-tested date-night boxes, sex toys, and other gadgets will make your Valentine’s Day extra sweet.

item.title: The Washington Post is retreating from Silicon Valley when it matters most
item.description: The Bezos-owned newspaper gutted its San Francisco bureau and coverage of tech — including journalists reporting on Amazon and Blue Origin

item.title: OpenAI launches new agentic coding model only minutes after Anthropic drops its own
item.description: The new model is build to accelerate the capabilities of Codex, the agentic coding tool OpenAI launched earlier this week.

item.title: Elon Musk is getting serious about orbital data centers
item.description: We’re starting to see the idea of Musk-owned orbital AI data clusters cohere into an actual plan.
